unicode.value: Este recurso educativo guía a los estudiantes a aprender y practicar vocabulario, estructuras gramaticales y habilidades de comparación relacionadas con las rutinas diarias en inglés. Incluye actividades colaborativas, juegos interactivos y presentaciones finales para reforzar el aprendizaje de forma dinámica.

Welcome to the Vocabulary Practice Website

Enhance your learning experience with interactive activities!

Module 1: Daily Routines Module 2: Vocabulary Practice Module 3: Comparing Routines Module 4: Final Game Module 5: Reflecting on Learning Module 6: Review of Vocabulary Module 7: Final Presentations

welcome to teacher Andrea's course by Andrea Guerrero Zuluaga

About This Course

Welcome to the English vocabulary practice course designed for A2-level students in the medical field. This course focuses on enhancing your language skills through engaging, interactive modules that revolve around daily routines and academic contexts.

What You'll Learn

  • Key vocabulary related to daily routines and academic activities.
  • Sentence-building and grammar applications for real-world contexts.
  • Interactive practice using platforms like Wordwall and Canva.

How to Navigate

Start with Module 1 and proceed sequentially. Each module includes specific activities, practice exercises, and evaluations. Click on the links in the navigation bar above to access the content.

Developed by Teacher Andrea Guerrero Zuluaga for the subject "Diseño y construcción de RED para la Especialización en TIC para la educación".

© 2024 Vocabulary Practice Course

Vocabulary Practice

1. Get to know the vocabulary: Digital Board

View on Canva by Andrea Guerrero Zuluaga

2. Practice Vocabulary: Matching Exercise

Daily Routines

1. Brush your teeth

2. Have a meal

3. Play sports

4. Go to school

5. Study

6. Go to bed

7. Have a shower

Module 2: Vocabulary Practice with Wordwall

Objective:

Practice and enhance your understanding of daily routines vocabulary through engaging interactive activities on Wordwall.

Tasks to Complete:

  • Access the Wordwall activity by clicking the provided link or embedded resource.
  • Complete the vocabulary exercises, including matching, word searches, and sentence-building tasks.
  • Take note of any unfamiliar words and review their meanings to expand your vocabulary.

Time Allocation:

Spend approximately 20-30 minutes on this activity to ensure you cover all exercises thoroughly.

Activities:

Activity 1: Hangman

Activity 2: Video Practice

Activity 3: Daily Routine Board Game

Module 3: Collaborative Board

Objective:

Collaborate with classmates to complete tasks and share ideas on a digital board. Practice English by describing your daily routines and comparing them with others.

Instructions:

  1. Open the collaborative board below.
  2. Write a description of your daily routine in English.
  3. Compare your routine with a classmate's routine by commenting on their post.
  4. Practice using comparative phrases, such as "My routine is busier than yours" or "I wake up earlier than my classmate."

Collaborative Board

# Set 1: Comparación de Rutinas  - by Andrea Guerrero Zuluaga

If the board does not load, click here to open it in a new tab.

🎮 Final Game - Collaborative Activity

Objective:

Play a fun game in teams to review daily routines!

Steps:

  1. Join your team and listen to the game rules. 
    1. In groups of 3 open the game in your tablet.
    2. Each member opens a box and ask the question to the group.
    3. In your notebook write the answers of your team.
  2. Look at the questions on Wordwall and discuss answers with your team.
  3. The group that finish first wins points for their team

Celebrate and get feedback at the end of the game!

Materials:

  • Tablets /Cellphones
  • Wordwall

💭 Reflection on Learning

Objective:

Think about what you’ve learned about routines and how you can use it in real life.

Steps:

  1. Look at the interactive board or sticky notes provided by your teacher.
  2. Share your thoughts on what you’ve learned about daily routines.
  3. Listen to your classmates and add your ideas.

Materials:

  • Interactive whiteboards
  • Sticky notes

Interactive board

Copy of Vocabulary by Andrea Guerrero Zuluaga
Module 6: Review of Vocabulary and Grammar

📖 Review of Vocabulary and Grammar

Objective:

Practice vocabulary and grammar in a fun and interactive way.

Steps:

  • Use your notes and tablet complete review activities.
  • Try vocabulary quizzes and build sentences.
Explore more at Quizizz.
  • Build sentences

  • Check your answers and get feedback from your teacher.

Materials:

  • Interactive tablets
  • Quizzes
  • Wordwall

🎤 Final Presentations

Objective:

Show what know, present your daily routines in English.

Steps:

1. Work with your group to prepare your presentation.

2. Use visual aids like pictures or posters to make it fun.

3. Take turns presenting your routines to the class.

4. Listen to feedback and celebrate your success!

Materials:

  • Cardboard or old boxes 📦📦📦
  • Magazines or newspapers (for pictures) 📰🎴📚
  • Markers, pens, or colored pencils 🖍️✏️
  • Scissors and glue (if available) ✂️🧴
